intro: Diplazium yangpieense, commonly known as the Yangpie Mountain spleenwort, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a thin layer of chlorophyll-rich cells. Diplazium yangpieense is typically found in temperate regions, often growing on rocks or soil in forested areas. Its reproductive structures, including antheridia and archegonia, are located on specialized leaves, typical of bryophytes.
